critique:
This document is an executive order from 1941 regarding the regulation of exports for national defense. It is difficult to assess its ideological tilt without more context, but given the time period and focus on national defense, it likely reflects a consensus view. Immigration is not addressed. The order expands executive power to regulate exports. Federalism is not directly addressed, but the order implies federal control over exports. The order prioritizes national security. It involves government intervention in the economy by regulating exports. Social inclusion is not addressed.
